reviews.review: "The best game ever made", Couldn't be a more accurate description of this game. A crown jewel that surpasses standards in todays modern gaming.

[b]10/10[/b]. Rise and shine, mr. Freeman, rise and shine...

Моя первая игра. Игра десятилетия. Игра на века! Именно HL2 во многом определил вид современных шутеров/экшенов. Однако нельзя воспринимать эту игру стандартными мерами оценки. Я могу сказать, что это самое удачное сочетание геймплея, игрового мира и сюжета в истории компьютерных игр. Приключения Фримена оставляют огромное место для творчества, но и внутриигровые события породили не одну дискуссию. Описывать HL2 - всё равно что пересказывать сон - удивительный, который можете понять, казалось бы, только вы. Если вы не играли в HL2, мне не о чем с вами говорить.

[h1][b]Hinweis: Half-Life 2 ist in Deutschland nur als gewaltgeminderte Version verfügbar!
Update 2019: Half-Life 2 ist in Deutschland vom Index gestrichen worden und darf nun auch ungeschnitten vertrieben werden. Der Steam Support führt dies auch nachträglich noch durch.[/b][/h1]

Die Geschichte von Half-Life 2 spielt in einer dystopisch anmutenden Zukunftsversion unserer Welt und auch dieses Mal schlüpft der Spieler in die Rolle des stummen Protagonisten Gordon Freeman, dem Held von Black Mesa aus dem ersten Teil der Serie. Neben einigen vertrauten Personen, die man im Verlauf des Spiels trifft, ist natürlich auch wieder die allerwichtigste Waffe mit von der Partie: Gordons Brechstange.
Und keine Sekunde zufrüh, den kaum in "City 17" angekommen wird er von den Combine gejagt, die sich als neue Herrscher über die Menschen auf dem Planeten etabliert haben.
Und das ist erst der Anfang. Die extrem spannende Story erstreckt sich nämlich über bis zu 18 Stunden Spielzeit und lässt selten an Spannung nach. Nur die Missionen im Hovercraft können zum Teil ermüdend sein.

Im Waffenarsenal unseres stummen Brechstangenschwingers befinden sich auch dieses Mal wieder viele verschiedene Waffen wie Schrotflinten, Sturmgewehre und eine Magnum und sogar einige der Waffen aus dem ersten Teil, wie der Raketenwerfer oder die Armbrust, sind mit am Start.
Die größte Neuerung ist jedoch die Gravity-Gun, die es erlaubt, Gegenstände aus der näheren Umgebung zu Wurgeschossen umzufunktionieren, die man dann auf seine Feinde schießen kann.

In vielen Leveln gibt es auch kleinere Rätsel, die den Spieler bei der Lösung mit Gesundheit oder Munition belohnen. Einige davon stellen in eindrucksvoller Weise die schönen Physikalischen Eigenschaften der Source-Engine heraus.
Und auch nach dem die Story durchgespielt ist, ist noch lange nicht Schluss: Im Internet gibt es haufenweise von Mods für Half-Life 2.

Schade ist jedoch, dass einige der futuristischen Waffen aus dem ersten Teil nicht dabei sind und die Gravity-Gun die einzig wirklich Neue ist.

[h1][b]Fazit[/b][/h1]

Alles in allem ist Half-Life 2 ein sehr gelungenes Spiel und gehört inzwischen zu den Klassikern in den allermeisten Spielesammlungen.
Für mich persönlich ist es eines der besten Spiele überhaupt. Klare Empfehlung!

I took my older brother along and he purchased this game for me, as I did not meet the age requirement for the games ERSB rating back in 2004.
I had not played the previous Half Life. However this game was phenomenal. I had never been so enthralled by an FPS game and its narrative. The pacing, delivery of the story, emotional performances of the characters.
Without a doubt a defining gaming experience for me.
Eagerly anticipating the future installments and thanks VALVE and Gabe Newell for bringing us such quality content.
If you've never played this game, I feel sorry for you.

Вторая часть легендарной Half-Life создавалась долгие шесть лет. За это время выросло целое поколение игроков, которые, однако, не забыли этот великий сериал. В сиквеле создатели не ударили в грязь лицом. Игрок снова оказывается в шкуре доктора Фримена, но на этот раз в будущем. В очень мрачном, надо заметить. Власть на земле находится в руках тоталитарного режима, а именно Фримену уготована роль освободителя. Новая история снова задает массу вопросов, практически не дает ответов, но при этом держит в напряжении до самого финала.

2004 год, Half-Life 2 вступает в битву с FAR CRY и DOOM3, и ему удается уделать обоих соперников почти по всем параметрам, но как? игра то слабее во многих шутерных аспектах.Этому есть обьяснение: дизайн+стиль+лоск+темп+много денег = Half-Life 2!
Half-Life 2 буквально лоснится от размера собственных производственных затрат, и от умения рассказывать внутриигровую историю.
В моем понимании Half-Life 2, это "СИТУАЦИОННЫЙ ШУТЕР" игра все время кормит игрока ситуациями,которых он, игрок ну ни как не ждет.В ней отличный темп подачи геймплея, от игры не устаешь, да-да она держит у экрана каким-то клеем из стрелбы смешанной с созерцанием ШИКАРНОГО стиля всего и вся.Местная атмосфера меняется несколько раз за всю игру,даже сегодня не все игры способны на такое.Half-Life 2 слеплен по старым лекалам,но каким-то образом настолько ладно склеен,настолько совершенен в своей нереволюционности,что про обилие недостатков тупо забываешь.
Half-Life 2 это уже классика (лично для меня) монструозный колосс с которым я познакомился в 2006 как только купил себе РС.

Самые зачетные ачивки: Двухочковый. Зомбомет. Ни шагу по песку.

[h1]A Crowbar, A Gravity Gun, And Unforeseen Consequences..[/h1]
In March of 2013, I bought [url=https://store.steampowered.com/sub/469/]The Orange Box[/url], a collection of "five of the greatest PC games ever made." At the time I was a fan of the second Portal game and I saw Portal 1 was included with some extra games. What I wasn't aware of at the time was that those "extra games" would turn out to be my [u]all-time favorite video games on any platform.[/u]

[h1]The Story of Half-Life 2[/h1]
The story of Half-Life would be complex to someone who has never experienced the series. The series includes everything from transdimensional beings invading a research facility in New Mexico, to a rising resistance against an alien species who dominated the planet in 7 hours. Half-Life explores all these events from the perspective of one theoretical physicist and MIT graduate Gordon Freeman, wielding his dangerously effective crowbar.

[h1]What Makes Half-Life 2 Different?[/h1]
What makes Half-Life 2 different from other FPS games is its approach to storytelling. Rather than building up its environment and setting, introducing all these new characters, and making you wait through annoyingly long cutscenes, the games just.. starts. I mean, it does have a very quick cutscene at the beginning of the game but it is so short that it isn't a bother. The game throws you into this dystopian setting without explanation or even a clear idea of where you are headed, but somehow you just find yourself going the right direction. This games storytelling is unmatched by any other game I have ever played, the story just unfolds as you play and that right there is what makes games enjoyable, "playing" them.

The game does not interrupt you to explain what is happening, you are not bombarded with information to process, you simply just play it. As you play, small details are explained and over time are subconsciously pieced together and by the end you understand its story without feeling like you had to think too hard about what was going on. Something I find annoying in other FPS games is all the tutorial interruptions, overloading amounts of backstory, and character introductions before you even start the game, I find myself wanting to take a break after the first 20 minutes of most new games that I play. But not Half-Life 2. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Gameplay is pretty standard yet fun, as this game is running on Valve's very own Source engine, used in many other games such as Portal, Team Fortress 2, Left 4 Dead, and Counter-Strike. I personally would argue that if you've played any of those other games running on the Source engine, then you can expect how gameplay is in Half-Life 2. Though what makes Half-Life 2 unique is its use of physics in the environment, to either progress in the level or as an advantage against enemies, as the Gravity Gun allows you to pick up objects and fire them back at enemies.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Overall, Half-Life 2 is an artistic masterpiece and to this day still represents what video games can allow the player to experience. Amazing story and characters that'll have you wishing for Half-Life 3...

Another classic that sets a standard for first-person shooters; however, its beginning is slow.  The first time I tried this game I gave up on it - it took too long to get going, although Half Life was like that too; but with Half-Life, it was original and innovative so it kept me interested to see where it was going.  After the action starts though in Half-Life 2 - give it 20 mninutes or so - then it's intense, exciting environments with new mechanics that are fun and easy to use.  I'll be playing this one again.

IF IT AIEN'T IN YOUR LIBRARY GO FETCH I THEN , Half Life is a must have if your a PC gamer it just shows you how you become attached to emotional characters and beautiful enviroments that are quite immersive without the use of cut scenes and quick time events altho there are scripted events it doesnt take the view out of your perspective from being abused to put a can in the trash to the glory of finishing the final boss all from a first person perspective. If any game likes to make a true FPS campaign they should take a book out of Half Life 2 how animations are , the look on the faces of NPCs around you can determine how the scene is tense or if it is filled with happiness , how physics can be in use and how level design can truly be a deciding factor of a great game and an average campaign .

Story :
You continue your life as Gorden Freeman as G-Man releases you from his time controlling space and start your journey meeting a lovely cast of characters and truly immersive enviroment and start in the upstart of a rebellion against the oppresive combine forces and invading aliens and friendly aliens.

Gameplay :
It still carries the same game mechanics and improving in some aspects such as physics that aren't just for show and the bugbait and what I love in a FPS no gun is perfect and none are without reason and levels are just what you expect for Half life a unique mix of levels with puzzles. (Movement is greatly improved from HL1)

Conclusion :
Half Life 2 is a true sequel and stays original to the series with immersion unparralelled and a must have for anybody.

Just played Half-Life 2 for the second time ever, and I have to say: I'm glad I played through again. The game has aged well graphically and plays more smoothly than ever thanks to the fact that it can run on almost every modern computer. Story, dialogue, and characters in HL2 are all stellar. Many people consider this game to be the most ground-breaking FPS ever made, even if it is getting a bit aged. I must agree - the game is phenomenal, and I eagerly await the next installment in the Half-Life or Half-Life-related universe (i.e. Portal 3 or...dare I say it...Half-Life 3)!

I liked it before, during, and after I had played it. Wonderful story along with puzzles as you fight off the Combine. There are many different twists and very detailed in its environments. The levels are beautiful (and if you haven't noticed already, it is in / near Russia) and are full of surprises. Three major enemies fight each other, but mostly aim to destroy you. Those enemies consist of the Combine, the Antlions, and the Zombies. The weapons are incredible and the gameplay is off the charts. I recommend this to anyone who looks first-person shooters with a twist.

When I look at this game and remember when I played it... I think about how much our "quality standards" have changed since those days, only a mere 8 years or so ago.

When this game came out... It was like a photo-realistic game. Now? We look at it and complain about pixelated textures, low environement polygony and details, etc.

In the future... Newer generations might not be able to understand the leap it was to go from a game like Half-Life 1 to one like Half-Life 2. They won't have FELT it. They can compare now, but we all know it's never the same.

But the story hasn't changed. It's the sequel to another of the greatest FPS games of all times, and it lives up to that name, but with some clichés, truth be told.

And don't forget about the episodes... You WILL WANT to know how the story continues.

An All-Time video game classic. Not much needs to be said about this game, as well as the first. Just buy it, and enjoy what can be considered as the best single player campaign, as well as the greatest overall video game of all time.
You owe it to yourself to play this game.

I remember playing the original Half Life multiplayer over LAN connection with friends in Jr. High. Since then I haven't played any of the series, but the nostalga was too much so I purchased this game, aa part of a Valve Steam Pack that granted access to it, its expansions, Portal, and Team Fortress. Upon playing the game, I was transported back, in a way, as Half Life 2 is an excellent second outing for this highly-touted series. I really enjoy the gameplay, the monstors are challenging, the guns are awesome, and the puzzle-esk gameplay is exactly as I remembered. The low graphical quality is easy to overlook, because the storyline and game mechanics are so captivating and fun, respectively. I know that I am only one of many who have voiced support of this game, particularly at this late date in its existence, but for the steam price you aren't going to get much more bang for your buck then this game. It, like Boondock Saints and Fight Club, has a cult following, and there's a reason for that. If you don't mind the outdated graphics it is well worth the price.
